TopicTitle: Suggestion: Space trains on celestial bodies.

Articles.Content: Assumably this would work best with with the Colonies or Resource Gathering milestones. As a gameplay function, space trains could move resources and Kerbals (and potentially more) around a celestial body as a player wishes to complete their mission objectives.

GIven some of the things that have been mentioned in past statements, I'm guessing that rover convoys will be possible across the surface as part of the automated supply lines. It (hopefully) won't just be launch-based; while fun, I can see suborbital hops being launched as part of the automated supply system as being incredibly inefficient and quite messy.

I understood it as a "virtual" convoy. You drive the route, the game remembers how long it took and how much cargo was transported and it will then keep delivering that, but without actually visible vehicles. Maybe I am wrong, but sadly I don't think I am.
it would make sense to set up rail systems between colonies, also maglev on low gravity bodies
Would make sense to have trains on high gravity planets.
